intro: Polygala schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Polygala schimperi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
